World of bugs

Home Real bugs Imaginary

Lady Beetle

  • commonly yellow, orange, or red with small black spots
  • six legs
  • 0.8 to 18 mm
  • eats leaves

Dung Beetle

  • Some dung beetles ride on the animals, whose feces they like to eat, until they are ready to poop.
  • There are 7000 types of dung beetles
  • All dung beetles can be divided in three large categories: rollers, tunnellers and dwellers
  • Dung beetles are very strong animals. They can carry the weight which is 50 times heavier than their body weight

Blow Fly

  • Blow flies are often shiny with metallic-like blue, green or black bodies and are slightly larger than a housefly
  • Adult blow flies have sponge-like mouth parts
  • Blow fly larvae are also known as maggots
